register.description: This register allows the setting of the I2C slave address of the Power IC device.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the IC slave address value for the second (if any) Power IC device.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the IC slave address value for the first Power IC device.

register.description: This register allows the setting of the voltage configuration register address for the VDD channels.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the voltage configuration register address value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the voltage configuration register address value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/Retention/OFF command configuration register address for the VDD channels. It is used if the Power IC device has different register addresses for voltage value and ON/Retention/OFF command.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF command configuration register address value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF command configuration register address value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/Retention/OFF voltage level values for the first VDD channel.

bitfield.description: Set the ON voltage level value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Set the ON-LP voltage level value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Set the RET voltage level value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Set the OFF voltage level value for the first VDD channel (VDD1).

register.description: This register allows the setting of the ON/Retention/OFF voltage level values for the second VDD channel. It is used if the second channel has different values than the first channel.

bitfield.description: Set the ON voltage level value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Set the ON-LP voltage level value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Set the RET voltage level value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Set the OFF voltage level value for the second VDD channel (VDD2).

register.description: This register allows the configuration pointers for both VDD channels.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Selects the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF voltage values for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Enable bit for usage of RAC1.
Set the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF command configuration register address pointer for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Set the voltage configuration register address pointer for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Set the slave address pointer for the second VDD channel (VDD2).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Selects the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF voltage values for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Enable bit for usage of RAC0.
Set the ON/ON-LP/Retention/OFF command configuration register address pointer for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Set the voltage configuration register address pointer for the first VDD channel (VDD1).
Set the slave address pointer for the first VDD channel (VDD1).

register.description: This register allows the configuration pointers for both VDD channels.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Put the I2C pads in a low power mode in case of light load.

bitenum.description: Disables the I2C pads low power mode
Enables the I2C pads low power mode

bitfield.description: Enables the I2C repeated start operation mode.

bitenum.description: Disables the repeated start operation mode
Enables the repeated start operation mode

bitfield.description: Enables I2C bus High Speed mode.

bitenum.description: Disables the I2C high speed mode
Enables the I2C high speed mode

bitfield.description: Master code value for I2C High Speed preamble transmission.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the Power IC device using the bypass interface.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
This bit validates the bypass command. It is automatically cleared by HW either after getting the acknowledge back from the SMPS or if an error occured.

bitenum.description: The last command send has been acknowledged
The Voltage Controller send the command to the I2C interface

bitfield.description: Data to send to the Power IC device.
Set the address of Power IC device register to configure.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Set the I2C slave address value.

register.description: Global software and DPLL3 reset control. This register is auto-cleared. Only write 1 is possible. A read returns 0 only.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
DPLL3 software reset control. This bit is reset only upon a global cold source of reset.

bitenum.description: Asserts the DPLL3 software reset and induces a global cold reset on the whole chip. The software must ensure the SDRAM is properly put in sef-refresh mode before applying this reset.

bitfield.description: Global software reset control. This bit is reset upon any global source of reset (warm and cold).
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.

register.description: Reset duration control.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
(Power domain) reset duration 2(number of RM_ICLK clock cycles)
(Global) reset duration 1(number of Func_32k.clk clock cycles)

register.description: This register logs the global reset sources. Each bit is set upon release of the domain reset signal. Must be cleared by software.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
IceCrusher reset event. This is a source of warm reset initiated by the emulation.
IcePick reset event. This is a source of warm reset initiated by the emulation.
VDD2 voltage manager reset event
VDD1 voltage manager reset event
External warm reset event
Reserved for non-GP devices.
MPU watchdog reset event
Reserved for non-GP devices.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Global software reset event
Power-up (cold) reset event

register.description: This register allows a direct control on the external power IC.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
This bit allows to select the mode used to control the Power IC (I2C or VMODE).

bitenum.description: The Power IC is controlled through theSR dedicatedI2C interface.
The Power IC is controlled through the VMODE interface.

bitfield.description: This bit allows to select the mode used to send the OFF command.

bitenum.description: The OFF command is send through the voltage controller I2C interface.

bitfield.description: This bit allows to send an OFF command to the Power IC.

bitenum.description: The OFF command is not send.
The OFF command is automatically send when the voltage domain is in the appropriate standby mode.

bitfield.description: This bit allows to send a RETENTION command to the Power IC through the voltage controller I2C interface.

bitenum.description: The RETENTION command is not send.
The RETENTION command is automatically send when the voltage domain is in the appropriate standby mode.

bitfield.description: This bit allows to send a SLEEP command to the Power IC through the voltage controller I2C interface.

bitenum.description: The SLEEP command is not send.
The SLEEP command is automatically send when the voltage domain is in the appropriate standby mode.

register.description: This register allows setting the pre-charge time of the SRAM.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of system clock cycles for the SRAM pre-charge duration.

register.description: This register provides control over the device source clock.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
This field controls the divider of the DPLL4 reference clock.

bitenum.description: The DPLL4 reference clock is the system clock divided by 1.
The DPLL4 reference clock is the system clock divided by 6.5.

bitfield.description: This field controls the system clock input divider
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
This field allows to control the external clock request (CLKREQ) and the oscillator

bitenum.description: CLKREQ is kept asserted or the oscillator is always active (in master mode)
CLKREQ is de-asserted or the oscillator is put in power-down mode (in master mode) when all the voltages domains are SLEEP, RETENTION or OFF states.
CLKREQ is de-asserted or the oscillator is put in power-down mode (in master mode) when all the voltages domains are RETENTION or OFF states.
CLKREQ is de-asserted or the oscillator is put in power-down mode (in master mode) only when all the voltage domains are in OFF states.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
This field reflects the mode of the ocillator. It is automatically set accordingly to the external tied-off configuration and its value is unsignificant before the release of the power-on reset.

bitenum.description: Bypass mode: the system clock is issued from an external square clock source
Oscillator mode: the system clock is issued from an external quartz
Unknow state (not know before release of the power-on reset)

register.description: This register logs the observable signals (18 bits). This register is intended to be read through the debugger interface when the device is in OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Read is undefined.
Indicates the current value on the observable bus.

register.description: This register allows setting the setup time of the VDD1 and VDD2 regulators. This register is used when exiting OFF/RET/SLEEP mode (or enters OFF/RET/SLEEP mode) and when device manages the sequencing of the voltages regulation steps.

bitfield.description: The value, in number of cycles of SYS_CLK, determines the setup duration of VDD2 regulator. The setup duration is computed as = 8 x number of cycles of SYS_CLK set in the register bit field.
The value, in number of cycles of SYS_CLK, determines the setup duration of VDD1 regulator. The setup duration is computed as = 8 x number of cycles of SYS_CLK set in the register bit field.

register.description: This register allows controlling the sys_offmode signal upon wake-up from OFF mode when the OFF sequence is supervised by the Power IC. This register allows setting the offset-time to de-assert sys_offmode when exiting the OFF mode.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of 32kHz clock cycles for the OFF mode offset time

register.description: This register allows setting the setup time of the oscillator system clock (sys_clk), based on number of 32 kHz clock cycles.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of 32kHz clock cycles for the SETUP duration

register.description: This register allows setting the polarity of device outputs control signals.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Controls the polarity of the sys_offmode signal
Controls the external output clock polarity when disabled

bitenum.description: sys_clkout is gated low when inactive
sys_clkout is gated high when inactive

bitfield.description: Controls the polarity of the sys_clkreq signal
Controls the polarity of sys_vmode signal

register.description: This register allows setting the overall setup time of VDD1 and VDD2 regulators. This register is used when exiting OFF mode and when the Power IC manages the sequencing of the voltages regulation steps.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read returns 0.
Number of 32kHz clock cycles for the overall setup time of VDD1 and VDD2 regulators.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Offset value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Gain value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Set the initial voltage level of the SMPS. It must be reconfigured before SmartReflex is enabled around a new OPP.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enable or disable the timeout capability of the Voltage Controller State Machine.

bitenum.description: Timeout is disabled. Loop will wait indefinitely.
Timeout will occur when TIMEOUT cycles have elapsed.

bitfield.description: Initializes the voltage in the Voltage Processor.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of InitVdd triggers a write of the value in the InitVoltage into the Voltage Processor.

bitfield.description: Forces an update of the SMPS.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of ForceUpdate triggers an update of the voltage to the SMPS.

bitfield.description: Enables or disables the Voltage Processor.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the minimum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for negative voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Minimum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the programming of the maximum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for positive voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Maximum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the voltage limits and timeout values of the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum voltage supply level.
Defines the minimum voltage supply level.
Defines Voltage Controller maximum wait time for responses.

register.description: This register indicates the current value of the SMPS voltage for the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Read is undefined.
Indicates the current SMPS programmed voltage.

register.description: This register reflects the idle state of the Voltage Processor 1 (VDD1). This register is read only and automatically updated.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Voltage Processor 1 idle status.

bitenum.description: The Voltage Processor 1 is in idle state.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2).

bitfield.description: Offset value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Gain value in the Error to Voltage converter (two's complement number).
Set the initial voltage level of the SMPS. It must be reconfigured before SmartReflex is enabled around a new OPP.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enable or disable the timeout capability of the Voltage Controller State Machine.

bitenum.description: Timeout is disabled. Loop will wait indefinitely.
Timeout will occur when TIMEOUT cycles have elapsed.

bitfield.description: Initializes the voltage in the Voltage Processor.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of InitVdd triggers a write of the value in the InitVoltage into the Voltage Processor.

bitfield.description: Forces an update of the SMPS.

bitenum.description: The positive edge of ForceUpdate triggers an update of the voltage to the SMPS.

bitfield.description: Enables or disables the Voltage Processor.

register.description: This register allows the programming of the minimum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for negative voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Minimum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the programming of the maximum voltage step and waiting time of the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Slew rate for positive voltage step (in number of cycles per step).
Maximum voltage step

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the voltage limits and timeout values of the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2).

bitfield.description: Defines the maximum voltage supply level.
Defines the minimum voltage supply level.
Defines Voltage Controller maximum wait time for responses.

register.description: This register indicates the current value of the SMPS voltage for the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2).

bitfield.description: Read is undefined.
Indicates the current SMPS programmed voltage.

register.description: This register reflects the idle state of the Voltage Processor 2 (VDD2). This register is read only and automatically updated.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Voltage Processor 2 idle status.

bitenum.description: The Voltage Processor 2 is in idle state.

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the ABB LDO (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Indicates if the ABB LDO is transitioning into a new mode of operation.

bitenum.description: The ABB LDO is not transition and the SR2_STATUS bits field is stable.
The ABB LDO is transitioning in a new mode and the SR2_STATUS bits field is not stable.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Indicates the current mode of operation of the ABB LDO.

bitenum.description: The ABB LDO is in bypass mode.
The ABB LDO is in FBB mode.

bitfield.description: The ABB LDO controller samples OPP_SEL bits field and ACTIVE_RRB_SEL and ACTIVE_FBB_SEL bit fields upon rising edge of this bit. It is automatically cleared by the PRCM HW upon completion of the ABB LDO transition.

bitenum.description: No ABB LDO transition on going or ABB LDO transition has been completed.
Request the ABB LDO to transition.

bitfield.description: Selects the OPP at which the voltage VDD1 is operating (or is going to switch to).

register.description: This register allows the configuration of the ABB LDO (VDD1).

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
This value times 8 is used to set the ABB LDO settling time to switch from the bypass mode to a Body-Bias mode.
Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Defines the ABB LDO mode when the voltage (VDD1) is in fast OPP (OPP1G).

bitenum.description: ABB LDO will operate in bypass mode.
ABB LDO will operate in FBB mode.

bitfield.description: Write 0s for future compatibility. Read is undefined.
Enables the ABB LDO.

bitenum.description: ABB LDO is in bypass mode.
ABB LDO will operate in FBB mode or bypass mode accordingly to the other SW settings and HW events.
